violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
A chemical SANITIZER used in a SANITIZING solution for a manual or
mechanical operation shall meet these limits or as otherwise approved: (P)
	Chlorine        ppm           pH<10             pH<8
		      25              120 F              120 F
		      50              100 F              75 F
		     100              55 F               55 F
                 Iodine           a concentration of between 12.5 and 25 ppm and minimum temp of 75 F and pH of 5 or less or meets manufacturer's specifications. (P)

                Quats            minimum temperature of 75 F, hardness of 500 ppm or less and meet manufacturers use directions. (P)

(A) The water source and system shall be of sufficient capacity to meet the peak water demands of the FOOD ESTABLISHMENT. (Pf)
(B) Hot water generation and distribution systems shall be sufficient to meet the peak hot water demands throughout the FOOD ESTABLISHMENT. (Pf)
Light of the proper intensity shall be provided as specified.

(A) An inside storage room and area and outside storage area and enclosure, and receptacles shall be of sufficient capacity to hold REFUSE, recyclables, and returnables that accumulate.   
(B) A receptacle shall be provided in each area of the FOOD ESTABLISHMENT or PREMISES where REFUSE is generated or commonly discarded, or where recyclables or returnables are placed.   
(C) If disposable towels are used at handwashing lavatories, a waste receptacle shall be located at each lavatory or group of adjacent lavatories.
Water from a PUBLIC and NON-PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM shall meet applicable State DRINKING WATER quality standards. (P)
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Does not meet state drinking water quality standards

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: NonFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of EQUIPMENT shall be cleaned at a frequency necessary to preclude accumulation of soil residues.
